tags.description:
Operations that can be initiated by the Central System at the Charge Points.
Some of these operations allows multiple Charge Points to be selected, whereas others are specific to a single Charge Point.
For the detailed information on the parameters, please refer to the OCPP specification.
tags.name: ocpp-operations-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to querying transactions.
A transaction represents a charging session at a charge box (i.e. charging station. The notions 'charge box' and 'charging station' are being used interchangeably).
tags.name: transaction-controller

tags.description:
Operations related to managing Ocpp Tags.
An Ocpp Tag is the identifier of the actor that interacts with the charge box.
It can be used for authorization, but also to start and stop charging sessions.
An RFID card is an example of an Ocpp Tag.
tags.name: ocpp-tag-controller

get.description:
Returns a list of Ocpp Tags based on the query parameters.
The query parameters can be used to filter the Ocpp Tags.

parameters.description: Database primary key of the OCPP tag
parameters.name: ocppTagPk

schema.description: Database primary key of the OCPP tag

parameters.description: The parent OCPP tag of this OCPP tag
parameters.name: parentIdTag

schema.description: The parent OCPP tag of this OCPP tag

parameters.description: Return expired, not expired, or all Ocpp tags? Defaults to ALL
parameters.name: expired

schema.description: Return expired, not expired, or all Ocpp tags? Defaults to ALL

parameters.description: Return in-transaction, not in-transaction, or all Ocpp tags? Defaults to ALL
parameters.name: inTransaction

schema.description: Return in-transaction, not in-transaction, or all Ocpp tags? Defaults to ALL

parameters.description: Return blocked, not blocked, or all Ocpp tags? Defaults to ALL
parameters.name: blocked

schema.description: Return blocked, not blocked, or all Ocpp tags? Defaults to ALL

parameters.description: Query by the note associated with the OCPP tag. The value of this field does not have to exactly match the note. A substring is also accepted.
parameters.name: note

schema.description: Query by the note associated with the OCPP tag. The value of this field does not have to exactly match the note. A substring is also accepted.

parameters.description: Filter by whether the OCPP tag is associated with a user or not. Defaults to All
parameters.name: userFilter

schema.description: Filter by whether the OCPP tag is associated with a user or not. Defaults to All

post.description:
Creates a new Ocpp Tag with the provided parameters.
The request body should contain the necessary information.

delete.description:
Deletes an existing Ocpp Tag based on the ocppTagPk.
Returns the deleted Ocpp Tag.

get.description: Returns a single Ocpp Tag based on the ocppTagPk.

put.description: Updates an existing Ocpp Tag with the provided parameters.

post.description: Only 1 charge point can be selected.
As specified in Improved security for OCPP 1.6-J white paper. installedCertificateId in payload is the database ID. Only 1 charge point can be selected.
As specified in Improved security for OCPP 1.6-J white paper.
As specified in Improved security for OCPP 1.6-J white paper. The certificates sent by the station will be stored in database.

As specified in Improved security for OCPP 1.6-J white paper. Request ID will be set automatically by backend. Once this operation is triggered at a station, it will send status notifications about the progress and result.
As specified in Improved security for OCPP 1.6-J white paper.
Only 1 charge point can be selected.
Only 1 charge point can be selected.
Only 1 charge point can be selected.

As specified in Improved security for OCPP 1.6-J white paper. Request ID will be set automatically by backend. Once this operation is triggered at a station, it will send status notifications about the progress and result.
Only 1 charge point can be selected.

get.description:
Returns a list of transactions based on the query parameters.
The query parameters can be used to filter the transactions.

parameters.description: Database primary key of the transaction
parameters.name: transactionPk

schema.description: Database primary key of the transaction

parameters.description: Return active or all transactions? Defaults to ALL
parameters.name: type

schema.description: Return active or all transactions? Defaults to ALL

parameters.description: Return the time period of the transactions. If FROM_TO, 'from' and 'to' must be set. Additionally, 'to' must be after 'from'. Defaults to ALL
parameters.name: periodType

schema.description: Return the time period of the transactions. If FROM_TO, 'from' and 'to' must be set. Additionally, 'to' must be after 'from'. Defaults to ALL

parameters.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)
parameters.name: chargeBoxId

schema.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

parameters.description: Show results that happened after this date/time. Format: ISO 8601 with timezone. Example: `2024-08-25T14:30:00.000Z`
parameters.name: from

schema.description: Show results that happened after this date/time. Format: ISO 8601 with timezone. Example: `2024-08-25T14:30:00.000Z`

parameters.description: Show results that happened before this date/time. Format: ISO 8601 with timezone. Example: `2024-08-25T14:30:00.000Z`
parameters.name: to

schema.description: Show results that happened before this date/time. Format: ISO 8601 with timezone. Example: `2024-08-25T14:30:00.000Z`

commaSeparatedCustomConfKeys.description: Comma separated sequence of Custom Configuration Keys

confKeyList.description:
List of Configuration Keys predefined by Ocpp.
The documented keys are the superset of all keys defined in Ocpp versions 1.2, 1.5 and 1.6.
Therefore, not all possible keys apply to all Ocpp versions.

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

location.description: The URL where charge point should upload the log file

retries.description: Number of times charge point should retry upload if it fails

retryInterval.description: Interval in seconds between retry attempts

start.description: Oldest timestamp to include in log file

stop.description: Latest timestamp to include in log file

GetInstalledCertificateIdsParams.description: Parameters for retrieving installed certificate IDs from charge points

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

errorResponses.description: Responses where the station successfully received the request, but responded with a CallError without any communication errors.

exceptions.description: Exceptions encountered when this platform failed to send the request to the station or failed to process the station's response.

successResponses.description: Responses where the station successfully received and processed the request, returning a CallResult without any communication errors.

taskFinished.description: True when all stations have completed communication (either with a CallResult, CallError, or exception) before the platform timeout. If timeout occurs before completion, this will be false and only partial results will be available.

idTag.description: Will be used in create/insert flows. Will be ignored in update flows.

activeTransactionCount.description: The number of currently active transactions for this OCPP tag

expiryDate.description: The date/time at which the OCPP tag will expire (if set)

inTransaction.description: Has the OCPP tag active transactions (i.e. ongoing charging sessions)?

maxActiveTransactionCount.description: The maximum number of active transactions allowed for this OCPP tag

parentIdTag.description: The parent OCPP tag of this OCPP tag

parentOcppTagPk.description: PK of the parent OCPP tag of this OCPP tag

userPk.description: PK of the user this OCPP tag belongs to (if any)

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

chargingProfilePk.description: PK of the charging profile to be used for the transaction. ChargingProfilePurposeType of the profile must be TX_PROFILE.

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)
The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)
The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

addUpdateList.description: User ID Tags to be added or updated

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

deleteList.description: User ID Tags to be deleted

sendEmptyListWhenFull.description: If set to true and the update type is FULL, an empty list will be sent. As a result, the charge point will remove all ID Tags from its list.

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

transactionId.description: Apply the profile to the transaction with this ID. ChargingProfilePurposeType of the profile must be TX_PROFILE.

SignedUpdateFirmwareParams.description: Parameters for signed firmware update with cryptographic verification

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

installDateTime.description: When charge point should install the downloaded firmware

location.description: URL where charge point can download the firmware

retrieveDateTime.description: When charge point should start downloading firmware

retryInterval.description: Interval in seconds between retry attempts

signature.description: Cryptographic signature of the firmware file

signingCertificate.description: PEM-encoded certificate used to sign the firmware

Transaction.description:
For active transactions, all 'stop'-prefixed fields would be null.
The energy consumed during the transaction can be calculated by subtracting the 'startValue' from the 'stopValue'.
The unit of the 'startValue' and 'stopValue' is watt-hours (Wh).

chargeBoxId.description: The identifier of the charge box at which the transaction took place

chargeBoxPk.description: PK of the charge box at which the transaction took place

connectorId.description: Connector ID of the charge box at which the transaction took place

ocppIdTag.description: The Ocpp Tag used in the transaction

ocppTagPk.description: PK of the OCPP tag used in the transaction

startTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which the transaction started

startValue.description: The meter value reading at the start of the transaction

stopEventActor.description: The actor who stopped the transaction

stopReason.description: The reason for the transaction being stopped

stopTimestamp.description: The timestamp at which the transaction ended

stopValue.description: The meter value reading at the end of the transaction

userId.description: The ID of the user who owns the Ocpp Tag associated with this transaction

items.description: The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)
The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)
The identifier of the chargebox (i.e. charging station)

location.description: URL where charge point can download the firmware

retrieveDateTime.description: When charge point should start downloading firmware

retryInterval.description: Interval in seconds between retry attempts
